expected_from_docs.name: segments
expected_from_docs.description: If true, each verse timestamp includes a `segments` array of [word_index, start_ms, end_ms] triplets. Time values are in milliseconds.

details.notes: Docs describe parameter that is absent from code spec.

expected_from_docs.name: foot_notes
expected_from_docs.description: If true, includes a foot_notes map keyed by footnote IDs (from <sup> tags) to their text.

details.notes: Docs describe parameter that is absent from code spec.

expected_from_docs.name: page
expected_from_docs.description: For paginating within the result

details.notes: Docs describe parameter that is absent from code spec.

expected_from_docs.name: per_page
expected_from_docs.description: records per api call, you can get maximum 50 records.

details.notes: Docs describe parameter that is absent from code spec.

expected_from_docs.name: translations
expected_from_docs.description: Comma-separated translation ids or slugs. Filters scoring and results to the specified translations only.

details.notes: Docs describe parameter that is absent from code spec.

expected_from_docs.name: language
expected_from_docs.description: ISO code of a translation language to boost (alias: `locale`). When omitted, we detect probable languages from the query string and search those translation indexes plus English.

found_in_code.name: language
found_in_code.description:
ISO code of language, use this query params if you want to boost translations for specific language.
For list of available language see  #endpoint:8rjMCZEyPEZMHAKz9 endpoint.

details.notes: default differs (code=en docs=None)

expected_from_docs.name: page
expected_from_docs.description: 1-based page number (alias: `p`). Defaults to the first page.

found_in_code.name: page
found_in_code.description: Page number, well for pagination. You can use *p* as well

details.notes: type differs (code=number docs=integer); default differs (code=0 docs=1)

expected_from_docs.name: q
expected_from_docs.description: Full-text query string (alias: `query`). Limited to the first 250 UTF-8 characters. Any HTML fragments are stripped before searching.

found_in_code.name: q
found_in_code.description: Search query, you can use *query* as well

details.notes: required differs (code=None docs=True)

expected_from_docs.name: size
expected_from_docs.description: Results per page (aliases: `s`, `per_page`). Values above 50 are capped. Default fetches 10 results.

found_in_code.name: size
found_in_code.description: Results per page. *s* is also valid parameter.

details.notes: type differs (code=number docs=integer); default differs (code=20 docs=10)

1 or true will include the words.
